result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ivy Marie Sowinski

records.addlTxt: of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)
of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

11:30 AM Defendant Ivy Marie Sowinski not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes Atty Saint Pierre has previously asked to withdraw and the request was denied, so Court was expecting her appearance today.
11:34am - Atty Saint Pierre joins the call. 
Deft is in custody and refusing to come to the phone for appearance today.
Court not allowing Atty Saint Pierre to withdraw due to findings by the Examiner and unsure how to proceed if Deft is unable to represent herself and does not have an Attorney.
Atty Saint Pierre agrees.
State cites statute 971.14(4)(b) regarding proceeding without Deft present.
Atty Saint Pierre has not been able to go over Report with client, but during conversation it was clear that Deft is aware of Report and contesting findings. By not coming to hearing today.
Court believes could reasonably be considered a waiver based on information given.
Atty Saint Pierre will leave up to Court's discretion whether appearance is waiver of right to object.
State believes by Deft not coming to hearing that Deft is standing mute on issue.
Court believes reasonable interpretation.
Defense has nothing further to add.
Court ids with Deft refusing to come, she is standing mute and Court will make findings - finds Deft incompetent but likely to regain with in patient treatment at State facility and involuntary med order.
Atty Saint Pierre requests no involuntary med order and to allow Deft the chance to comply and if not compliant then can bring a motion for involuntary.
State believes grounds for forced compliance and unsure how long it would take to bring motion back to Court.
Court will order involuntary medication order.
Atty Saint Pierre requests review date in 3 months.
Review hearing scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing on January 25, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
to Withdraw as Counsel of Record - Atty. Saint Pierre

Attorney Christin Saint Pierre is appointed as counsel.
No reimbursement.
$100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
of Appearance

Deft refusing to come to the phone for Court.
Deft appeared before Court Commissioner and Commissioner raised competency and sent to Circuit Court.
Court orders Competency Evaluation - Clerk to prepare Order.

1:41 PM Defendant Ivy Marie Sowinski in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Mahmood in person, as court officer, raises competency on deft. The deft. did not want representation of a public defender. Court also raises competency based on deft.'s appearance/acts in court. 
Given complaint-Bond set-950/Marsy's Law complied with-Probable cause found in the complaint.
Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
